website_summaries.verdict: A super-soft bristle set offering fun color options for customers wanting to avoid the neutral design of other bamboo brushes.
pros: Various color option available, including neutral designs
Made specifically with ultra-soft bristles that are plant-based
cons: Super soft bristles do not last as long as harder bristles from other companies

customer_reviews.title: Great toothbrush
customer_reviews.text: First, the packaging is all cardboard, no plastic at all. This is the reason why I chose this brand over others. Second, the bristles are soft and gentle on my sensitive teeth. I read some people show excessive wear on their toothbrush after only a couple of months. Well, that sounds normal to me. Its recommended by dentists to replace your toothbrush every 3 months or so. I'm happy to be able to reduce my plastic use and save the environment at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: K. Moore

customer_reviews.title: My favorite bamboo toothbrushes
customer_reviews.text: I have tried 3 other brands of bamboo toothbrushes, and this is by far the best! I have very sensitive gums that demand I use an extra soft toothbrush (or they up and recede on me, so rude). These have soft enough bristles to keep my gums happy! I also *really* like that the packaging does NOT have a surprise plastic film sleeve around the toothbrush... thank you!! The whole reason I switched to bamboo was to reduce plastic use - so, GoWoo gets a big happy thumbs up from me, my gums, and the environment. Good job guys!
customer_reviews.author: c.love

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't allow for a good cleaning.
customer_reviews.text: Bristles are way too soft. I know they’re meant to be soft, but I just couldn’t get a good clean with these. After a weeks use, my gums were sore. When I finally went back to a regular toothbrush it felt soooo good! I had a bit of blood after brushing but my gums are much more healthy after switching back. It’s unfortunate because I really wanted to break from the plastic toothbrush. I will continue looking for a bamboo brand that gives me a good clean.
customer_reviews.author: Adrianne

customer_reviews.title: Uses less plastic, I like the feel of this toothbrush
customer_reviews.text: I like these and reorder because I don't love plastic and I don't like the feel of some toothbrushes either. If you dispose of your bamboo toothbrush every 2-3 months (I change mine around easy to remember holidays so I don't forget) then you shouldn't see splinters of wood or anything - these are good toothbrushes. Also, I keep these on hand in case guests forget to bring theirs. If it isn't their preferred thing, then when they throw it away at least it isn't more plastic sitting around forever. Plus the packaging is recyclable. This is an easy way to make a small change and it doesn't hurt your teeth.
customer_reviews.author: K Reichert

customer_reviews.title: Very Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I am still excited with the use of the toothbrushes. I'm in transition of making small changes for the environment and I'm glad I started with this brand & this item. It does feel different than the standard plastic but it's a "good different". Packaging is awesome. I will definitely purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Squirt2

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Toothbrushes
customer_reviews.text: These toothbrushes are really amazing and my family loves them. I get them on subscribe and save to avoid having to remember to order and they come like clockwork. I love the colors that they come in which makes it easier to differentiate whose is whose. They have the most wonderful benefit of being biodegradable. We add them to our burnable trash so no plastic. Really great product and great price.
customer_reviews.author: patty klocko

customer_reviews.title: Small Head
customer_reviews.text: These toothbrushes are lovely, and the bristles are soft, yes. I liked the colors so we could easily identify multiples in one holder. However, the heads are small. Small is good for getting in tight spaces, but they are small nonetheless. Also, I saw other bamboo brushes for lower prices, though I have not tried them yet. All I know is using wooden toothbrushes is immeasurably better for the environment than the classic plastic brushes. These bristles won't break down easily, but the handles will decompose much quicker than a plastic alternative.
customer_reviews.author: nycmom

customer_reviews.title: A new must-have
customer_reviews.text: After trying multiple other bamboo toothbrushes, I was about to give up until I tried this brand. The bamboo is smooth and does not splinter like most other brands. My husband who is very picky about toothbrushes actually likes using these, which is great because I can reduce his environmental impact. The bristles also stay in tack, which again was another issue I had with other bamboo brushes. Packaging is also individual ecofriendly boxes, which is nice for travel. I highly recommend and I will be buying these from here on out!
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Did not care for bristles
customer_reviews.text: I have been experimenting with different bamboo toothbrushes to try and find the ones that work best for our family. The two positives: 1) they are different colors, which makes it easy to tell them apart 2) They have a smooth, round grip, which is more ergonomic than some of the other brands I've tried. Unfortunately, none of us like the bristles. They feel too scratchy and at the same time don't seem to do a good job making our teeth feel clean unless you really scrub, which then irritates your gums. One of my children has braces, and these bristles kept getting stuck. For those reasons, I would not buy this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Audg

customer_reviews.title: Good idea, but I'm not impressed with the product
customer_reviews.text: I like the idea of these toothbrushes more than the actual execution. The toothbrush is too soft for my liking, which I was surprised by as I have always used a soft toothbrush. I would classify this as an extra soft toothbrush, not really capable of clearing off adult size plaque from my adult size mouth. I find the toothbrush pretty cumbersome to use as well, I think the wood at the head of the toothbrush is too thick and I find it difficult to reach the back of my mouth with it. Will continue looking for a brand that more closely replicates the performance of a plastic toothbrush.
customer_reviews.author: Eslieb

customer_reviews.title: Weird at first
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty great once you get used to them. It feels very strange to brush your teeth with a piece of wood, and honestly, it gave me the heebie-jeebies for a few weeks but once I got used to it they were fine. My only complaint is that the head of the brush is a little small. This bothers my husband more than me, he says its hard to really get in there and make his teeth feel clean, my teeth feel super clean tho. Honestly, it keeps plastic out of the ocean so it's worth getting used to a little weirdness. I'll buy these again for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Keir B

customer_reviews.title: I love the idea
customer_reviews.text: I bought this toothbrush because I want to limit my plastic trash. Although I love the idea of this product I sometimes feel like my teeth are not as clean after I brush vs my old toothbrush. I'm not going back to plastic but I would like to see some product improvements in the future.
customer_reviews.author: DCantu82

customer_reviews.title: I really fell in love with the toothbrush's shape and colors
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for the right eco-friendly toothbrush to use and this product's design was what caught my eye. I really fell in love with the toothbrush's shape and colors. However, I am a rough brusher. These bristles are too soft and flimsy - when I brush, I feel as if my teeth go straight through the bristles and rub on the wood. I really wanted to like this brush so I was a little disappointed. Might be better for people with more sensitive teeth.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not my favorite.
customer_reviews.text: I am all about saving the planet but I just want a fan of these tooth brushes. I don’t think it is brand I got I think it’s the bamboo in general. They did not last as long and it always irritated my lip. My boyfriend tried one too and he didn’t care for it either. Maybe if they had something softer on the top part of the brush so it rub as much.
customer_reviews.author: Bethany Hall

customer_reviews.title: Waste not want not
customer_reviews.text: I love my small transitions to making my carbon footprint smaller and these brushes are great. I love the variety of color. The bristles are however really really soft. I know tooth brushes have different grades of softness and I was recommended the softest, but this is softer than I thought was imaginable and I worry it’s too soft. I need the soft bristles to make it in between some weird spacing on my far back molars, but I worry they’re not strong enough to actually scrape the plaque off well. I’ll definitely use these until I’m out but I’ll probably be trying other brands in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Lillian Rae

customer_reviews.title: Not a fan of the bristles
customer_reviews.text: These toothbrushes are exactly as pictured, with a beautiful design, I'll give them that. I bought these to create less waste when throwing away toothbrushes, but I'm not a fan. The bristles don't brush your teeth as well as regular toothbrushes- and the bristles get destroyed pretty fast. My teeth don't feel like they get very clean. I went through all four way faster than I thought I would.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Shelton

customer_reviews.title: Great environmentally friendly alternative
customer_reviews.text: These toothbrushes are a great substitute for your normal plastic one. The bristles are just right--not too soft and not too firm. I like that I'm not adding even more plastic to a landfill. I might even try to figure out a use for them when I'm done. (I mean, besides cleaning stuff). I'm a little bit worried about clearing away bamboo forests so I hope these are harvested sustainably.
customer_reviews.author: PepiBumbo

customer_reviews.title: ... been moving to more reusable and environmentally friendly things like cloth napkins
customer_reviews.text: I have been working to slowly lessen my carbon footprint and have been moving to more reusable and environmentally friendly things like cloth napkins. Bamboo is a quick growing plant and it is smart to utilize it like this as it just comes back! The handles are nice and smooth and the bristles dont hurt my teeth. All in all it is a great alternative to modern toothbrushes.
customer_reviews.author: Catie

customer_reviews.title: Clean teeth
customer_reviews.text: I love these as my first transition to plastic free too th brushes. They have very soft bristals. Most people might not like this but hard bristals hurt your gums and enamal. Soft is all you need and a good tooth paste. My teeth were still getting whiter but i was not getting the white spots on the front of my teeth like I used to with normal tooth brishes. I love the colors, plastic free packaging and the handles. Recommened
customer_reviews.author: Ramirez Tribe Mama

customer_reviews.title: Best brushes in the world 100 00plus stars
customer_reviews.text: My favorite tooth brushes I've ordered these for years there the best toothbrushes I've ever owned plus there black and white so match my minimalist house decor. I hope amazon continues to sell these forever. Worth every penny I would rate it a 100plus stars
customer_reviews.author: princess cat

customer_reviews.title: Not reccomended if you like clean teeth
customer_reviews.text: I like that these come in 100% recyclable packaging and that the toothbrushes are biodegradable, but the quality of cleaning from the bristles is seriously lacking. My husband got frustrated with his toothbrush after just a couple weeks and switched back to our old brand. I stuck it out for a couple months, but I'm over having to do so much extra work to get a good, "clean feeling" mouth. Hopefully I can find another eco-freindly brand that has better quality bristles.
customer_reviews.author: J.

customer_reviews.title: Wish they had more colors
customer_reviews.text: When you first start using bamboo toot brushes it feels weird, the wood in your mouth instead of plastic, but one gets used to it... i love the colors and that the bristles are different colors. With that said. I tend to bite my tooth brushes and so the problem that I’m finding with bamboo is that it cracks and the bristles start falling off while I brush my teeth. My son doesn’t have that problem though so I’m working on the biting down the toot brushes habit. I never liked soft tooth brushes felt like didn’t clean my teeth well so I was a bit apprehensive but not anymore my teeth feel squeaky clean now.
customer_reviews.author: Catalina

customer_reviews.title: We buy these often
customer_reviews.text: Love the tooth brushes. The kids love them. We change toothbrushes about every other month as I have asthmatics and we want to make sure every time they get sick we change. We keep it on a rotation these are an automatic order this helps me to keep up with changing them on a regular basis. Thanks so much!
customer_reviews.author: Alanya

customer_reviews.title: Not the best
customer_reviews.text: They were okay. They’re really soft so if you like firm bristles this is not for you. Also I don’t know if anyone else had this problem but the bristles kept falling out of mine. Every time I’d brush my teeth there would be bristles in my mouth :(
customer_reviews.author: Zindarella

customer_reviews.title: Bristles are very soft
customer_reviews.text: If your looking for VERY SOFT bristles this product is for you! However it is probably too soft for my preference. I been using it for a couple days and a couple bristles already seem to be coming loose/ falling out. Next time I would buy the medium softness and see how that feels. Overall, I will keep using these toothbrushes because I like how they are biodegradable and good for the planet since they’re made out of bamboo.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: ok
customer_reviews.text: I was on the hunt for a more "natural" toothbrush for my boys. I thought this was a good brand and reviews so i ordered them. My kids like the colors of the toothbrushes but that was about it. There were extremely light and when under water the WHOLE toothbrush would be wet, which they didn't like. Also after a couple brushes they bristles were falling out. We ultimately threw them away.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren K.

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: It's actually no different than the "regular" toothbrushes you find at the store but the key difference is that it's not made out of plastic! There's no weird aftertaste or anything of the sort. Just a normal toothbrush that I will definitely be buying again for me and my family.
customer_reviews.author: Priscilla Torres

customer_reviews.title: Cleans well, nice that it's eco friendly
customer_reviews.text: I love these. It's great to know that they won't be clogging up a landfill. I wish they were a little cheaper, but I like supporting eco friendly companies. The bristles are soft and I think they clean just as well as my old toothbrush. My spouse uses them, too, and does not like the texture of the bamboo but is still able to use them.
customer_reviews.author: Clementine17

customer_reviews.title: Great option to plastic toothbrush
customer_reviews.text: So happy to have found an alternative to the plastic toothbrush. The feel is different, for sure, but the quality of the brush is superb. I purchased them for my 6 year old as well, this gives us the chance to discuss our Mother Earth and our efforts to keep her safe. Thanks for this product.
customer_reviews.author: catherine colburn

customer_reviews.title: Wear Out Quickly
customer_reviews.text: This is the second bamboo toothbrush I've tried and I found that the bristles start losing their shape after about a week of using the toothbrush. I would go with a different brand next time or go back to the Sprmal ones I used before which were great and hold up really well.
customer_reviews.author: Gina Ellis

customer_reviews.title: These are great!
customer_reviews.text: Each toothbrush came in its own smaller box which is nice for storing them until it’s time to use them. The bristles of the toothbrush are soft and it is easy to clean hard to reach spots like the backs of bottom teeth. I have already noticed a difference in how clean my mouth feels.
customer_reviews.author: BHuds

customer_reviews.title: I quite like these toothbrushes
customer_reviews.text: I quite like these toothbrushes. The bristles are nice and soft. (I've been using them just over a week and all the bristles have stayed securely in their places.) I was looking for eco-friendly toothbrush and I definitely found one. No plastic packaging! My only draw back (and why I gave it 4 stars) is the stem of the brush, going from the handle to the brush head, is pretty wide so it doesn't fit in the cover I have which is slightly annoying, but not a huge deal.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: My new go-to
customer_reviews.text: We’re trying to switch from plastic to a more sustainable option for the products we use and these are great! I’d you've never used bamboo toothbrushes before it takes a bit to get used to the texture of the bamboo vs plastic but that was the only “negative” thing I found with these. They work well for me and my kids, and they actually look pretty in the cabinet vs the old plastic ones. These are definitely my new go to toothbrushes!
customer_reviews.author: Leah

customer_reviews.title: good quality bamboo toothbrush; nylon bristles though
customer_reviews.text: I love the lack of plastic packaging and the cute colors that they come in. Great Quality! Be careful though: this toothbrush has nylon bristles. I haven't found any toothbrush that has 0% plastic in it yet, so this is about as minimal plastic as you can get (unless you want to start chewing on sticks instead of brushing your teeth). I'm not saying this to dissuade you from buying it, but everyone should know exactly what they're ordering.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. We're really trying to reduce our use of ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. We're really trying to reduce our use of disposable plastics that then never breakdown in landfills. It's a bit of a change getting used to the feeling of bamboo, but not much. They dry quickly, are light, and the bristles are a good soft/medium texture. Would definitely buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: bookbug

customer_reviews.title: Worth a shot
customer_reviews.text: Very soft bristles. Each brush lasts me a month or so. Makes me feel good inside to use a brush that can actually be recycled. Been using them for a few months now and plan to continue. They are different feeling from the usual store bought brush and now seem weird at first but I don’t find myself missing a more traditional brush at all after a few months.
customer_reviews.author: Moose

customer_reviews.title: SUPER soft bristles leave my teeth SUPER clean!!!
customer_reviews.text: These are the BEST toothbrushes I have ever used, even better than those handed out by my dentist! The bristles are SOOOO soft up against my sensitive gums. NO bleeding when I brush at ALL! That's a first! And I love the feel of the bamboo handles. These feel like they're so well made and will last for quite awhile, but I'm very glad that when they DO finally wear out, it won't take forever for them to break down and return to the earth in a usable form again. Win-win-win for everyone!!! :)
customer_reviews.author: Chris47451

customer_reviews.title: Cute looking but slightly less eco-friendly
customer_reviews.text: I have tried a lot of different bamboo toothbrushes over the last few years. These ones have a more ergonomic grip than some of the other brands and they have very cute colors. They also are much cheaper than some of the other brands. Unfortunately, the bristles are made from nylon. Another brand I tried had some kind of natural fiber and charcoal which I thought was a nicer option.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: A wonderful eco friendly purchase
customer_reviews.text: I love these toothbrushes! These were one of my first steps transitioning into a low-waste lifestyle. The bamboo is smooth and the bristles are soft. I appreciate the different colors so I can share the eco-friendly love with my family without confusing whose toothbrush is whose. One of the main reasons that I picked these over other bamboo toothbrushes is the 100% recyclable packaging. The only small issue I have is that the bristles sometimes come out when brushing. Will buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Katie Maye

customer_reviews.title: Great for the environment
customer_reviews.text: I bought this toothbrush to try and cut back on plastic. I don’t think I get quite as good of a brush though as I did with brands like Crest. I would still probably buy again! And pro tip for any toothbrush, reuse them to clean small crevices in places like the bathroom or kitchen
customer_reviews.author: Chelsey

customer_reviews.title: Green and great!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Works better than plastic ones to me and I like that they’re a little more green! You will have to change them a little more frequently than the plastics but I’m still very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Eco Friendly, but left my teeth feeling a little fuzzy after a few days of use.
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping to find a biodegradable toothbrush that would not end up as part of a plastic trash island in the Pacific. Nice brush, but it really didn't seem to get my teeth as clean as my electric brush. Perhaps that is not a fair comparison. Took it on a 2-week trip to Ireland, and by the time I got back home I was so happy to see my Oral-B. Also, a couple of the bristles were working their way out by the end of the trip. I guess there are trade-offs for everything.
customer_reviews.author: NewKate

customer_reviews.title: Very nice toothbrushes. Color coded so you don't get confused ...
customer_reviews.text: Very nice toothbrushes. Color coded so you don't get confused on whos whos. Smooth bamboo so no splinters. Works great. Tapered so you dont have a bunch of bamboo in your mouth. Great for kids and adults.
customer_reviews.author: Ladylyps

customer_reviews.title: I love the look of these
customer_reviews.text: I love the look of these, but after a week or so they smell really bad, and one even got a black mildewy spot on the bamboo. Not worth it. Update: The seller was great and refunded my money. They said you need to make sure they dry all the way out. My kids were using these, so maybe they would work better for adults. They are really cute.
customer_reviews.author: C. Tinker

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: This toothbrush is a price of junk it falls apart in two days and feels like your brushing your teeth with a plastic leaf
customer_reviews.author: Sindhu DeCent

customer_reviews.title: Soft Bristles
customer_reviews.text: So far after a few uses, it is doing is job as a toothbrush. The bristles were surprisingly soft, which I was worried about, but it is pleasant. The wood is smooth and polished over, so no worries about it splintering. So far a good choice to less plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Lexi

customer_reviews.title: Great toothbrushes
customer_reviews.text: Great toothbrushes. Works just like any other, and better for the environment, as opposed to 100% plastic toothbrushes. The bristles are soft, so if you prefer medium or firm bristles, you may have to look elsewhere. For my needs, they are excellent.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful, eco friendly product. GoWoo is my "go to" for toothbrushes
customer_reviews.text: I love my new toothbrushes!! I need the gentleness of a soft brush and these are delightful. Thank you so much!!!
customer_reviews.author: marty

customer_reviews.title: My dentist is very pleased!
customer_reviews.text: I started using this toothbrush and a toothpaste I made myself, and my dentist said she could see a big change! Less plaque buildup and whiter teeth! Plus I'm hopefully helping the environment!
customer_reviews.author: HP

customer_reviews.title: Trying to Reduce Plastics
customer_reviews.text: I'm trying to reduce my usage of plastics, and my toothbrush was the next step. I chose this brand because of the different colored bristles, it makes it easy for two of us to tell them apart. It's an adjustment, but because I know I'm helping the environment I'm willing to make the adjustment. After a week or two of usage, I'm satisfied with this product.
customer_reviews.author: C. Clark

customer_reviews.title: A bit of a let down
customer_reviews.text: I love how soft the bristles are, but they keep coming loose as I brush. Also, I feel like I’m about to get a splinter in my mouth from the handle because it’s not as sanded down as it should be.
customer_reviews.author: Lashley Nowotny

customer_reviews.title: Love the idea of a Bamboo toothbrush
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for stocking stuffers so I haven't used them as yet but I really appreciate the fact they are made of bamboo. I always give my kids and husband new toothbrushes for Christmas and this year will be more "green". I'm really trying to cut the plastic waste. Thank you for creating these.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality toothbrushes
customer_reviews.text: We really like our new toothbrushes. There a nice size and soft. We tried eco friendly toothbrush before, but they were a bit oversized and the bristles were too firm. These are just right and we plan on buying this brand of brushes again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: The actual bristle head of the toothbrush is smaller than I'm used to, but I really like it. The bristles are soft but not useless and brush well. This is my first bamboo toothbrush and it will take a little while to get used to but I really like it so far.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Horn

customer_reviews.title: Love the idea, better products out there
customer_reviews.text: Use these to reduce carbon footprint after seeing how long it takes for toothbrushes to decompose. This was the first one I purchased. Did have a light wood taste that others have not had, and also did start to mildew, which is not a problem I had with others. Did like the colors so you can differentiate between.
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: We love these tooth brushes better than my plastic ones
customer_reviews.text: I have a bimonthly subscription to these toothbrushes. We really like them and I like the idea of recyclables toothbrushes to the plastic ones. The bristles are strong to clean in between your teeth yet gentle on your gums.
customer_reviews.author: AA

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied customer
customer_reviews.text: My children and I all like these brushes. They are too soft to clean tongues with, but we use a different tongue cleaner for this anyways. The softness is probably better for less gum erosion, so I intened to continue purchasing soft brushes. I feel better about tossing these then the all plastic ones I had been buying. Love the competitive price.
customer_reviews.author: A. silver

customer_reviews.title: Great plastic toothbrush alternative
customer_reviews.text: The box came with 4 individually packaged toothbrushes each in their own box - no extra plastic packaging here! Each toothbrush has a coloured base so it's easy to prevent any mix-ups. The tootbrush has a great feel and the bristles are soft on the gums. Minor con would be the brush head is a bit small, but just means taking a bit more time at the sink. Overall happy with the purchase so far.
customer_reviews.author: Keshtav Ramdial

customer_reviews.title: Better than plastic!
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd order of GoWoo bamboo toothbrushes. I was looking for an alternative to plastic and these work for me. They're just a basic old-school toothbrush style, nothing like the fancy plastic ones I used to use, but they work. Occasionally, a random bristle will come loose, usually when I start using the toothbrush, but it's not a big deal. I like the colors.
customer_reviews.author: Linda B.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't clean well
customer_reviews.text: These are more environmentally friendly, but they might cost you in dental bills and mouth wash. They are so soft bristled that they don't do a really good job cleaning, if you floss after using these you get A LOT of stuff that the tooth brush just didn't get even with added pressure. They also feel kind of splintery which makes me nervous when brushing, though I haven't had any splinters. I switched back to regular plastic tooth brushes, they aren't as good for the planet but I can't stand my teeth not feeling clean.
customer_reviews.author: Skylar

customer_reviews.title: Unpleasant and less effective
customer_reviews.text: I’m trying to reduce my plastic consumption, and really wanted to like these, but... The wood feels drying and uncomfortable in your mouth, and with the bristles not angled I feel like it is harder to get my teeth clean. Will look into other options.
customer_reviews.author: Karrathan

customer_reviews.title: Great Toothbrushes
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these toothbrushes because they are bamboo and because they are biodegradable. Turns out, they are also excellent toothbrushes. They have soft bristles and they are color coded (four in a box) so that everyone knows which toothbrush is theirs. Pretty nifty!
customer_reviews.author: dushdash

customer_reviews.title: so I felt as though I had to scrub harder than I normal would have to make sure my teeth were clean but I love the idea of a natural toothbrush
customer_reviews.text: The bristles are rather soft, so I felt as though I had to scrub harder than I normal would have to make sure my teeth were clean but I love the idea of a natural toothbrush. Will be ordering more. The colors are so fun too!
customer_reviews.author: Alexis Bizzell

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Just started using this product... so far I’m really pleased. The handle feels good in my hand, and the bristles are soft on my gums. I’ll update if anything changes, but as of right now I’ll be adding another set to my basket.
customer_reviews.author: G's mama

customer_reviews.title: Shipped in a massive plastic envelope?
customer_reviews.text: Toothbrushes seem fine, but can you tell me why when I’m trying to be eco conscious these are mailed to me in a plastic envelope?! Seems counter productive to say the absolute least.
customer_reviews.author: E.G.

customer_reviews.title: Will Take some getting used to
customer_reviews.text: I’m giving four stars because I am so against throw away plastic use ! I purchased these for entire family . I’m going to give my opinion after using . It feels awkward and I kept wanting to use the Plastic toothbrush I had not thrown out yet and if you slip while brushing you’ll get a knock with this wood Handle ! So change needs to happen so we are sticking with our new bamboo environmentally friendly toothbrushes !
customer_reviews.author: kim causey

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried a few brands of bamboo toothbrushes and really like this brand! Some brands I've tried have a head that's a bit too large but this one is perfect. The brush wears out after about 2 months but that's a fine time to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE THESE!! YOU WILL LOVE THEM TOO!!
customer_reviews.text: I loved these tooth brushes!! They are super cute with a variety of colors. It doesn’t feel any different from using a plastic tooth brush, excerpt I know I’m doing my small part by using tooth brushes like these. Some of my family members have even tried to take one. So I’ll definitely be buying more soon and never buying plastic tooth brushes again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This product is as described. I recieved mine on time. Packaging is recyclable. I love the different colors so my family isn’t mixing up toothbrushes. My kids love their toothbrushes and I love mine! Every little bit helps when it comes to taking care of our environment.
customer_reviews.author: S LeCren

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Completely changed the way I brush. Thorough but gentle bristles. Excellent
customer_reviews.author: ausboy

customer_reviews.title: Don't work.
customer_reviews.text: I use a lot of bamboo products, so I used to the general feel of it. My beef with these is how long the bristles are. So long that they just bend and dont clean your teeth.
customer_reviews.author: storm

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Works well for me and my husband! The head of the brush it slightly bulkier compared to the plastic ones but we’ve gotten use to it.
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: Perfect bristle softness
customer_reviews.text: I have bought several brands of bamboo toothbrushes and these seem to be the best. The bristles are soft like they claim to be, which is what I prefer. It is easy to use. There is a transition period to get used to a bamboo base compared to plastic, but once that is over there really is no difference in quality.
customer_reviews.author: Brittnee

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT clean well
customer_reviews.text: I am all for saving the environment but these toothbrushes DO NOT clean your teeth very well at all. I have never had the experience of brushing my teeth, properly, and still seeing plaque on my lower teeth. It's gross. Do not purchase if you care about the health of your teeth.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Good for the whole family.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for me,but my sons have grabbed some and love them too.
customer_reviews.author: C.M.

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Smooth handle, soft bristles, no taste or smell, and bright and cheery colors. My husband even commented on how much he likes these toothbrushes, so I ordered a second 4 pack just to have on hand.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Thank you for making such biodegradable products
customer_reviews.text: Super quality product, enjoyed using it. My kids enjoyed brushing . I have satisfaction using bio degradable product. I like the brushes wrapped in cardboard boxes . Will recommend to all my friends . Thanks for making such eco friendly products
customer_reviews.author: Pradeep

customer_reviews.title: Works just like a toothbrush!
customer_reviews.text: I love how lightweight it is and how there’s no difference in brushing my teeth. It makes me feel good that I won’t be throwing away plastic anymore. Will definitely keep purchasing them and recommending them.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah

customer_reviews.title: Finally no more plastic
customer_reviews.text: I like these and will get more in the future
customer_reviews.author: Nads

customer_reviews.title: Pretty and soft
customer_reviews.text: These brushes are beautiful and definitely soft bristles. I like the small brush size as well. Its hard to find small toothbrushes without buying kids brushes.
customer_reviews.author: Eva

customer_reviews.title: Eco-friendly and functional
customer_reviews.text: Colors help us keep track of whose is who’s. Eco-friendly. Bristles pull out with pliers when it’s time to replace, and handle is compostable at that point.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Druckenmiller

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. My kids and I like them. Super soft bristles. Thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: Quiana

customer_reviews.title: Nice toothbrushes!
customer_reviews.text: Great toothbrush. No wood taste or rough feeling in my mouth. Bristles are soft to medium which is what dentists recommend. Nice smooth handle and packaged in individual boxes, no plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra L Winans

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your buck (teeth)! 😂
customer_reviews.text: I search long and hard for environmentally conscious products. These toothbrushes are terrific! The comfortable handle fits nicely in my hand and the soft bristles are a treat to my teeth and gums. The colors are pretty and not obnoxious. I’m thrilled to have found these at such a reasonable price. The quality is sublime. It’s a bonus that they are environmentally friendly. I’ll never go back to a traditional tooth brush. Love your teeth AND the planet by buying these toothbrushes!!
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Really great product
customer_reviews.text: Love the fact of course that it's from a sustainable source so & that it's well made so well worth the money, we are enjoying using theses toothbrushes.
customer_reviews.author: Lee U Roy

customer_reviews.title: Makes your lips raw
customer_reviews.text: These are made of completely “naked” bamboo which sounds great until about the 5th time you brush and your lips start to get sore and raw. There’s no protective sealant on these. I used clear fingernail polish to coat them with in order to use them.
customer_reviews.author: Colton

customer_reviews.title: Good way to be more eco-friendly.
customer_reviews.text: Overall a good product and a really easy way to be more eco-friendly. I will say the first brush I used got a little poke-y after using it a few times after the friction from brushing caused the bamboo to wear away a little and get some bumps and grooves on it. It's hard to explain, so hopefully that makes sense. It wasn't a big deal in the end, just wanted to point out one of the things I noticed that was different from using a plastic brush.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Best purchase by far. Eco friendly, super soft nylon bristles(especially great for those with sensative gums/teeth), and anyone who says the bristles fray too easily is brushing their teeth too hard. Definitely recommend this product and the Panda(black and white) colors are so cool looking! Will definitely continue buying these toothbrushes!
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: The toothbrushes are ADORABLE and I love that they're made from 100% bamboo
customer_reviews.text: The toothbrushes are ADORABLE and I love that they're made from 100% bamboo, but the bristles are a bit too soft, and they got pretty bent after only the first use. I still love them though.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie R

customer_reviews.title: Great Toothbrush
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this toothbrush primarily as an environmentally friendly alternative to plastic, but the quality and price make it a good buy regardless. The round handle and bristle construction give it a nice durable feel, and the colors are appealing and would probably be a hit with kids. Best bamboo toothbrush I have found.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Carson

customer_reviews.title: Splinter in my lip
customer_reviews.text: These tooth brushes looked and felt great until they gave me a splinter in my lip.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased with this natural choice toothbrush
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 4 toothbrushes for each member of my family - the only reason I didn't give it 5/5 stars is that the feel of the bamboo is just slightly less smooth when brushing than a plastic toothbrush - it may take a little getting used to for some people....HOWEVER....all other aspects of the brush are fantastic! My kids loved choosing their color (the bristles and end of the brush were blue, yellow...etc) and have made the switch to bamboo. I don't think we will go back to plastic brushes again: ) .
customer_reviews.author: TLV

customer_reviews.title: Bristles Fall Out
customer_reviews.text: They’re cute and don’t feel to clunky in your mouth, but the bristles fall out CONSTANTLY and I have to pull them out from between my teeth after every brush. Going with a different brand
customer_reviews.author: Ariel

customer_reviews.title: I love brushing my teeth!
customer_reviews.text: I have recession of my gums in various places from brushing my teeth too hard and with too hard of bristles over the years. I switched to soft bristles but I hated throwing a plastic toothbrush in the trash every couple of months. I came across these bamboo toothbrushes and was worried about the softness of the bristles. I AM SO HAPPY I ORDERED THEM. They are softer than any tooth brush I've ever had and I actually ENJOY brushing my teeth for at least two minutes. It is such a wonderful experience and a massage for my teeth and gums!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Like them-- bad shape!
customer_reviews.text: I like these toothbrushes just fine, but round is apparently not the ideal shape for the handle of a toothbrush! it turns in my hand as I'm trying to brush. They work for what they're intended to do.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay Bates

customer_reviews.title: great brush and great value
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these brushes because they can be composted. I was very pleasantly surprised to find out how well made they are. Great value for the money. I highly recommended them!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy E.

customer_reviews.title: Going to try and find a better one
customer_reviews.text: Made the sides of my mouth very weird. I thought I just needed time to adapt to the new type of toothbrush since this was my first bamboo toothbrush, but it never did. I also felt like my mouth wasn’t as clean. I switched back to my plastic toothbrush :( going to try and find another brand that hopefully works better.
customer_reviews.author: dallas

customer_reviews.title: Not my favorite but had worse
customer_reviews.text: These hurt my gums a bit. The bristles weren't hard but they didnt seem to work well for me. I'm very picky though so could just be me. Cute colors and nice presentation and good price.
customer_reviews.author: ciennakay

customer_reviews.title: Work as expected!
customer_reviews.text: They work great! They are soft and eco friendly which is why I like these! They are however a bit big for my smaller mouth!
customer_reviews.author: K-Lee42

customer_reviews.title: Harder than you think
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant at first because my experience with soft bristles is that you might as well wipe a towel on your teeth. This is good though, softer than medium but not ultra soft.
customer_reviews.author: Me

product_meta.title: GoWoo 100% Natural Bamboo Toothbrush Soft - Organic Eco Friendly Toothbrushes with Soft Nylon Bristles, BPA-Free, Biodegradable, Dental Care Set for Men and Women, (Pack of 4, Adult, Rainbow)
feature_bullets: ✅ BPA FREE & ECO-FRIENDLY: These specially designed biodegradable toothbrushes are designed to give you a natural way to keep your teeth bright and white. GoWoo bamboo toothbrushes are 100% BPA Free, Phthalate Free, PVC Free as well as being Biodegradable & Compostable and perform better than traditional toothbrushes!

✅ SUPER SOFT NYLON BRISTLES: Our Natural Bamboo Toothbrushes use BPA Free Super Soft Nylon Bristles that provide just the right care to keep your gums healthy and teeth white.  Extra soft bristles protect your gums from bleeding or scratching so you can brush easily and safely - Perfect For Sensitive Gums.

✅ SMOOTH & NATURAL BAMBOO HANDLE: Premium quality and sustainable Bamboo Wood is used to make our bamboo toothbrush which is way stronger than normal wood, plus it does not blister or start chipping. These Natural Bamboo toothbrushes are water resistant too, you will not have to dry the handle after use as well as ensuring long-term use.

✅ MULTI- COLOR: This set of 4 Eco Friendly Toothbrushes is a perfect choice for any family that wants to live the green life. Each toothbrush’s bottom is painted to keep the end from rotting, and also we offer different color combinations.
✅ 100% RECYCLABLE PACKAGING: Not only our bamboo toothbrushes are biodegradable, but also our packaging is totally recyclable. We are doing the best to protect our environment.
